com.konakart.appif

Interface FetchProductOptionsIf

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FetchProductOptions

    public interface FetchProductOptionsIf
    An object used to define options used when reading one or more products from the database

      • isGetTierPrices

        boolean isGetTierPrices()
        If true we attach an array of TierPrice objects to the product. Defaults to false for performance reasons since you may not require tier prices until you fetch the product details.
        Returns:
        the getTierPrices

      • isInvertRelatedProductDirection

        boolean isInvertRelatedProductDirection()
        If true we invert the direction of the related product link. This is especially useful for bundled products, so rather than discovering the products within a bundle, you can determine which bundles a product belongs to by setting this attribute to true
        Returns:
        the invertRelatedProductDirection

      • setInvertRelatedProductDirection

        void setInvertRelatedProductDirection(boolean invertRelatedProductDirection)
        If true we invert the direction of the related product link. This is especially useful for bundled products, so rather than discovering the products within a bundle, you can determine which bundles a product belongs to by setting this attribute to true
        Parameters:
        invertRelatedProductDirection - the invertRelatedProductDirection to set

      • isCreateListOfUniqueProducts

        boolean isCreateListOfUniqueProducts()
        This attribute is only used by the API calls getBundlesThatProductBelongsTo() and getBundlesThatProductsBelongTo(). These methods return an array of products, each of which has an array of bundled products. The same products may be repeated many times within the array of bundled products which can affect performance since the amount of data returned can be very large. When createListOfUniqueProducts is set to true, the bundled products are only populated with the product id, the quantity and the encodedOptionValues to make them very much lighter. Also within the Products return object the uniqueProductArray attribute is created and populated with a unique set of products that includes just one copy of all of the bundled products.
        Returns:
        the createListOfUniqueProducts

      • setCreateListOfUniqueProducts

        void setCreateListOfUniqueProducts(boolean createListOfUniqueProducts)
        This attribute is only used by the API calls getBundlesThatProductBelongsTo() and getBundlesThatProductsBelongTo(). These methods return an array of products, each of which has an array of bundled products. The same products may be repeated many times within the array of bundled products which can affect performance since the amount of data returned can be very large. When createListOfUniqueProducts is set to true, the bundled products are only populated with the product id, the quantity and the encodedOptionValues to make them very much lighter. Also within the Products return object the uniqueProductArray attribute is created and populated with a unique set of products that includes just one copy of all of the bundled products.
        Parameters:
        createListOfUniqueProducts - the createListOfUniqueProducts to set

      • isGetRelationshipData

        boolean isGetRelationshipData()
        Only used by the API call getRelatedProductsWithOptions. If set to true, the return Products object contains an array of ProductRelationship objects which contain data specific to each relationship.
        Returns:
        the getRelationshipData

      • setGetRelationshipData

        void setGetRelationshipData(boolean getRelationshipData)
        Only used by the API call getRelatedProductsWithOptions. If set to true, the return Products object contains an array of ProductRelationship objects which contain data specific to each relationship.
        Parameters:
        getRelationshipData - the getRelationshipData to set

      • getInventoryUpdateExcludeProdTypes

        int[] getInventoryUpdateExcludeProdTypes()
        Used to define product types that are excluded from inventory updates. Used in the updateProductQuantityWithOptions() API call of the ProductMgr. Valid product types are:
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.PHYSICAL_PRODUCT
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.DIGITAL_DOWNLOAD
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.FREE_SHIPPING
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.BUNDLE_PRODUCT_TYPE
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.FREE_SHIPPING_BUNDLE_PRODUCT_TYPE
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.GIFT_CERTIFICATE_PRODUCT_TYPE
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.BOOKABLE_PRODUCT_TYPE
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.VIRTUAL_PRODUCT_TYPE
        Returns:
        the inventoryUpdateExcludeProdTypes

      • setInventoryUpdateExcludeProdTypes

        void setInventoryUpdateExcludeProdTypes(int[] inventoryUpdateExcludeProdTypes)
        Used to define product types that are excluded from inventory updates. Used in the updateProductQuantityWithOptions() API call of the ProductMgr. Valid product types are:
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.PHYSICAL_PRODUCT
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.DIGITAL_DOWNLOAD
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.FREE_SHIPPING
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.BUNDLE_PRODUCT_TYPE
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.FREE_SHIPPING_BUNDLE_PRODUCT_TYPE
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.GIFT_CERTIFICATE_PRODUCT_TYPE
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.BOOKABLE_PRODUCT_TYPE
        • com.konakart.bl.ProductMgr.VIRTUAL_PRODUCT_TYPE
        Parameters:
        inventoryUpdateExcludeProdTypes - the inventoryUpdateExcludeProdTypes to set

      • isForceUseSolr

        boolean isForceUseSolr()
        This attribute also exists in the ProductSearch object. It's repeated here for the API calls
        • getProductsPerCategoryWithOptions()
        • getProductsPerManufacturerWithOptions()
        • getProductsPerCategoryPerManufacturerWithOptions()
        which don't receive the ProductSearch object as a parameter.

        When set to true, Solr is used even though KonaKart may not have used Solr. By default, Solr is only used when doing text searches or when returning custom facets.

        Returns:
        the forceUseSolr

      • setForceUseSolr

        void setForceUseSolr(boolean forceUseSolr)
        This attribute also exists in the ProductSearch object. It's repeated here for the API calls
        • getProductsPerCategoryWithOptions()
        • getProductsPerManufacturerWithOptions()
        • getProductsPerCategoryPerManufacturerWithOptions()
        which don't receive the ProductSearch object as a parameter.

        When set to true, Solr is used even though KonaKart may not have used Solr. By default, Solr is only used when doing text searches or when returning custom facets.

        Parameters:
        forceUseSolr - the forceUseSolr to set

      • isGetStoreName

        boolean isGetStoreName()
        If true, when in multi-vendor mode the store name attribute of the product is populated. It defaults to true.

        the getStoreName
